intro: Cyrtandra limnophila, commonly known as the marsh cyrtandra, is a tropical plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant thrives in wet, marshy environments and is often found near streams or in lowland wetlands. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra limnophila plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various insect and bird species.
